overview: This subject lays a firm foundation for further studies in the education of health professionals. The basics of teaching and learning theory are presented with clear linkages to the clinical workplace to ensure immediate relevance and applicability.

An engaging mix of seminars, workshops, on-line learning and practical activities in the workplace meets the needs of clinicians who teach learners at any level, while an intensive option might appeal to those with limited availability.

In recognition of the occupational demands on busy clinicians, contact days will typically occur on consecutive days at the Parkville campus during the semester with 4 hours devoted to this subject on each of the days.
Teaching will be split between lectures (1 hour), seminars or symposia (1 hour), and small group work (2 hours).

additional pre-requisite: Admission into one of the following:
Admission into or selection of one of the following:GC-CLINED Graduate Certificate in Clinical EducationGD-CLINED Graduate Diploma in Clinical EducationMC-CLINED Master of Clinical Education
GC-CLINED Graduate Certificate in Clinical Education
GD-CLINED Graduate Diploma in Clinical Education
GC-CLINED Graduate Certificate in Clinical Education
GD-CLINED Graduate Diploma in Clinical Education
This subject is not available for students admitted in any other courses.

assessments.description: Individual oral presentation - 1,500 words equivalent. 15 minutes
Portfolio documenting outcomes from participation in seminars and workshops during the semester. 2000 words
Written assignment in the form of an issues or discussion paper on a topic relevant to the participant's particular clinical teaching and learning context. 1500 words

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
